apiDescription: Executes the destructor (if any) of the pointed-to value.

It is required to use drop_in_place to drop unsized types like trait objects, because they can't be read out onto the stack and dropped normally. It is friendlier to the optimizer to do this over ptr::read when dropping manually allocated memory (e.g. when writing Box/Rc/Vec), as the compiler doesn't need to prove that it's sound to elide the copy.
This has all the same safety problems as ptr::read with respect to invalid pointers, types, and double drops.
